com.thisismydesign.shellexecutor

Class ShellExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thisismydesign.shellexecutor.ShellExecutor

  • public class ShellExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
    This class supports executing shell scripts.

    It provides a clean interface, QoL features and solves several issues such as:

    • handling of both output streams (stdout and stderr)
    • handling quote characters in commands
    • providing commands as whole Strings instead of indefinite number of arguments

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> execute(java.lang.String cmd)
                                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                                       java.lang.InterruptedException
        Starts 'cmd' command and waits for it to finish. Returns List of output lines (both stdout and stderr).

        Will call cmd with 'sh' command so that it may contain quotes

        Parameters:
        cmd - bash command
        Returns:
        output lines
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if ProcessBuilder.start() throws IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if Process.waitFor() throws InterruptedException

      • call

                 throws java.io.IOException
        Starts 'cmd' command asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        cmd - bash command
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if ProcessBuilder.start() throws IOException

      • executeWithPrint

        public static void executeWithPrint(java.lang.String cmd)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    java.lang.InterruptedException
        Starts 'cmd' command and waits for it to finish.

        After finished prints lines to stdout.

        Parameters:
        cmd - bash command
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if ProcessBuilder.start() throws IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if Process.waitFor() throws InterruptedException

      • executeWithAssert

        public static boolean executeWithAssert(java.lang.String cmd,
                                        java.lang.String[] ok,
                                        java.lang.String[] nok)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        java.lang.InterruptedException
        Starts 'cmd' command and waits for it to finish.

        Asserts successful execution based output and 'ok', 'nok' keywords provided.

        Parameters:
        cmd - bash command
        ok - keywords in output signaling correct execution
        nok - keywords in output signaling incorrect execution
        Returns:
        whether execution was correct
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if ProcessBuilder.start() throws IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if Process.waitFor() throws InterruptedException
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no keyword is found
